title: Level up with the DataStax Developers!
description:
Come and level up with the DataStax Developers! Join us as we host multiple workshops each week, focusing on a host of topics that you will know and love. Now is the time to master them!

ðŸ“¥ Sign up to our Event Alert mailing list:

There are over 8000 of us chatting in there.
https://bit.ly/cassandra-workshop


CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastaxdevs?sub_confirmation=1 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastaxdevs
Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/datastaxdevs

About DataStax:
DataStax is the company behind the massively scalable, highly available, cloud-native NoSQL data platform built on Apache Cassandraâ„¢. DataStax gives developers and enterprises the freedom to run data in any cloud, Kubernetes, hybrid or bare metal at global scale with zero downtime and zero lock-in. More than 450 of the worldâ€™s leading enterprises including Capital One, Cisco, Comcast, Delta Airlines, Macyâ€™s, McDonaldâ€™s, Safeway, Sony, and Walmart use DataStax to build transformational data architectures for real-world outcomes. For more, visit DataStax.com and @DataStax.

About DataStax Developer:
On the DataStax Developers YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, workshops and much more to help you learn and stay updated with the latest information on Apache CassandraÂ©.  Visit https://datastax.com/dev for more free learning resources.

transcript.text: [Music] and welcome everyone to the cassandra workshop series the grand finale where we bring our application to the cloud okay yeah just i'm good scan through stuff to make sure we didn't miss anything [Music] and leaderboard changes a little bit but all the leaders answer it correctly what about the leaderboard who was the fastest now who gets the first place [Music] there should be no big changes definitely these are really nice actually for training materials like what we're doing right now they're also really nice to share so now i'm going to the ui getting started with ui i will do the npm install [Music] as a beginner i would say this was very useful to understand the feature of cassandra i'm really thankful to the organizing team the eight-week journey was wonderful and each week was equally exciting [Music] you
